radiographic_examinations.findings: spiculated nodule in the left lung, with left hilar prominence

spiculated nodule (1.7 cm in diameter) in the left upper lobe and left hilar lymphadenopathy; bone lesions including a lytic lesion (2.3 cm in diameter) at the level of the ninth thoracic vertebra; no evidence of pulmonary embolism
foci of 18F-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) avidity in the left upper lobe mass and in mediastinal and hilar lymph nodes, eighth transverse process, ninth thoracic vertebral body, and right ninth rib
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: FDG-avid foci in the right ninth rib and in lymph nodes in the mediastinum, hilum, and right supraclavicular region had increased in size

radiographic_examinations.findings: atelectasis in the left upper lobe
complete collapse of the left upper lobe due to an obstructing endobronchial lesion
elevated left hilum with adjacent opacity; consistent with a collapsed left upper lobe

low-attenuation lesion (2 cm in diameter) at the left hilum consistent with known lung cancer; complete occlusion of the bronchus of the left upper lobe, patchy consolidation in the left lower lobe, and multiple lytic lesions in the thoracic skeleton
